tasks.title: Implement Server-Sent Events (SSE) Infrastructure for CV2WEB
tasks.description: Create SSE endpoints for real-time streaming of CV extraction, portfolio generation, and sandbox status updates. Define standardized message types for progress tracking, step notifications, completion status, errors, and warnings.
tasks.details:
## Implementation Overview

### 1. SSE Infrastructure Setup
- Configure server to support SSE connections with proper headers:
  ```
  Content-Type: text/event-stream
  Cache-Control: no-cache
  Connection: keep-alive
  ```
- Implement connection management for handling multiple concurrent SSE streams
- Set up heartbeat mechanism to keep connections alive (send `:keepalive\n\n` every 30 seconds)

### 2. Create SSE Endpoints

#### CV Extraction Endpoint: `/api/cv/extract-streaming`
- Accept POST request with CV file/data
- Return SSE stream with extraction progress
- Stream events for each extraction step (parsing, entity recognition, formatting)

#### Portfolio Generation Endpoint: `/api/portfolio/generate-streaming`
- Accept POST request with portfolio parameters
- Stream generation progress including template selection, content generation, and finalization steps

#### Sandbox Status Endpoint: `/api/sandbox/status-streaming/{job_id}`
- Accept GET request with job ID parameter
- Stream real-time status updates for sandbox operations
- Support reconnection with Last-Event-ID header

### 3. Message Type Definitions

Define standardized SSE message format:
```json
{
  "id": "unique-event-id",
  "type": "progress|step|complete|error|warning",
  "timestamp": "ISO-8601-timestamp",
  "data": {
    "message": "Human-readable message",
    "percentage": 0-100, // for progress type
    "stepName": "string", // for step type
    "stepNumber": 1, // for step type
    "totalSteps": 5, // for step type
    "result": {}, // for complete type
    "errorCode": "string", // for error type
    "stackTrace": "string" // for error type (optional)
  }
}
```

### 4. Implementation Considerations
- Use event IDs for client-side reconnection support
- Implement proper error handling and graceful connection closure
- Add request validation and authentication middleware
- Consider implementing rate limiting for SSE connections
- Use connection pooling for efficient resource management
- Implement timeout handling for long-running operations

### 5. Client Integration Support
- Provide TypeScript interfaces for message types
- Create client-side EventSource wrapper with automatic reconnection
- Include example client code for consuming SSE streams
tasks.testStrategy:
## Testing Strategy

### 1. Unit Tests
- Test message formatting for each message type (progress, step, complete, error, warning)
- Verify proper SSE event structure with correct headers and data format
- Test connection management including concurrent connection limits
- Validate heartbeat mechanism timing and format

### 2. Integration Tests
- **CV Extraction Streaming**: Upload test CV and verify:
  - Initial connection establishment
  - Progress events at expected intervals
  - Step events for each extraction phase
  - Complete event with extracted data
  - Error handling for invalid CV formats
  
- **Portfolio Generation Streaming**: Submit generation request and verify:
  - Streaming updates for each generation phase
  - Progress percentage accuracy
  - Warning messages for optional features
  - Complete event with portfolio data
  
- **Sandbox Status Streaming**: Create test job and verify:
  - Real-time status updates
  - Reconnection with Last-Event-ID
  - Multiple client connections to same job
  - Proper cleanup on job completion

### 3. Performance Tests
- Load test with 100+ concurrent SSE connections
- Measure memory usage under sustained load
- Test connection recovery after network interruption
- Verify no memory leaks in long-running connections

### 4. Client Compatibility Tests
- Test with native EventSource API in modern browsers
- Verify fallback behavior for older browsers
- Test mobile browser compatibility
- Validate reconnection logic across different network conditions

### 5. End-to-End Scenarios
- Complete CV extraction workflow with real-time UI updates
- Portfolio generation with progress bar integration
- Sandbox monitoring dashboard with multiple status streams
- Error recovery scenarios with user notification
